subject: Re: JUnit and EJB! please help, a beginner

messageBody:
Hi

Thanks for all the replies. Some of them have been helpful (ie. the
one that pointed me to jboss, cactus), althought most of 'em aren't.
I've decided to go to a bookstore and pickup a book on EJB. I
figured if i get familiar with EJB, it might be easier to understand
the testing itself.
Before, I was looking for a quick solution, by trying to look for
hands on tutorial which explains about EJB as well as the testing
itself. I guess there's no such thing out there. most of the
tutorial on the testing is assuming that you are already familiar
with EJB. I got frustated after spending so many hours, and not
being able to get anything useful out of google, and decided to post
a message here to see if the experts here can offer some guide.

However, I must say this. I am really disappointed at some of the
replies out there which really don't address the real question. I am
asking for some pointers on where to start looking if i were to
learn ejb and junit, and the replies that i got are totally
irrelevant and unnecessary.
I am sure that most of you that hang around here must be
professional developer with years of programming experience, but the
way you guys address a simple question is really out of context.
A beginner asked for a hint or two cuz he wants to learn, and
instead of giving some hints, many of you are questioning his
background, and some even are implying that maybe he's totally out
of place, and should not be doing this; which does't answer the
question at all.

Anyway, I am just expressing myself, and I hope that I don't offend,
or tick off anyone. I totally appreciate the time you guys took to
reply to my message.


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Andrew Forward" <milkforlife@h...>

research
